TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit InlineUIContainer extends System.Windows.Documents.Inline

Docs.summary: An inline-level flow content element which enables <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> elements (i.e. a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>) to be embedded (hosted) in flow content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> element (i.e. a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>) may be embedded directly in flow content by enclosing it in a InlineUIContainer (see example below).
An InlineUIContainer may directly host no more than one <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> child. However, the child element hosted by an InlineUIContainer may host children of its own.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the InlineUIContainer elements to host <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> elements within flow content.
[!code-xml[SpanSnippets#_InlineUIXAML](../../add/codesnippet/Xaml/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml#_inlineuixaml)]
The following figure shows how this example renders.
![Screenshot: UIElement elements embedded in flow](../../add/media/inlineuicontainer.png "Screenshot: UIElement elements embedded in flow")

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new, empty instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer"> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.UIElement childUIElement) cil managed

Docs.param: An <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> object specifying the initial contents of the new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer>.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer"> class, taking a specified <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> object as the initial contents of the new <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer">.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates usage of this constructor.
[!code-cs[SpanSnippets#_InlineUI_Const1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#_inlineui_const1)] [!code-vb[SpanSnippets#_InlineUI_Const1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/spansnippets/window1.xaml.vb#_inlineui_const1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.UIElement childUIElement, class System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer insertionPosition) cil managed

Docs.param: A <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> object specifying the initial contents of the new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer>. This parameter may be `null`, in which case no <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> is inserted.

A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"> specifying an insertion position at which to insert the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer> element after it is created, or `null` for no automatic insertion.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer"> class, taking a specified <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> object as the initial contents of the new <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer">, and a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer> specifying an insertion position for the new <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer"> element.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates usage of this constructor.
[!code-cs[SpanSnippets#_InlineUI_Const2](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#_inlineui_const2)] [!code-vb[SpanSnippets#_InlineUI_Const2](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/spansnippets/window1.xaml.vb#_inlineui_const2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> hosted by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer> may directly host no more than one <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> child. However, the child element hosted by an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer> may host children of its own.
In [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_titlexaml](../../add/includes/tlasharptla-titlexaml-md.md)], wrapping a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> in an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer> is equivalent to setting that <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> as the value of the Child property.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer> elements to host <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> elements within flow content.
[!code-xml[SpanSnippets#_InlineUIXAML](../../add/codesnippet/Xaml/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml#_inlineuixaml)]
The following figure shows how this example renders.
![Screenshot: UIElement elements embedded in flow](../../add/media/inlineuicontainer.png "Screenshot: UIElement elements embedded in flow")
The following example shows how to use the Child property programmatically.
[!code-cs[SpanSnippets#_InlineUI_Child](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#_inlineui_child)] [!code-vb[SpanSnippets#_InlineUI_Child](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/spansnippets/window1.xaml.vb#_inlineui_child)]
